item.title: 'It's all going right for Arsenal' - can they make it count this time?

item.title: Man Utd 'lack quality, fluidity and chances' - and 'expect better'
item.description: Manchester United's players "expect better" than drawing 1-1 at home to Wolves, says stand-in captain Lisandro Martinez.

item.title: Gabriel & Saliba dominate as Arsenal make 'big statement'
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy analyses how Gabriel Magalhaes and William Saliba dominated in defence for Arsenal in their 4-1 victory over Aston Villa.

item.title: Set-pieces 'becoming a problem' for Chelsea
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Rob Green discuss where Chelsea fell short in defending set pieces in their 2-2 draw with Bournemouth.

item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Rob Green discuss how James Garner influenced Everton's 2-0 win at Nottingham Forest.

item.title: Match of the Day
item.description: Highlights of six Premier League games, including Arsenal v Aston Villa.

item.title: Reaction after wins for Motherwell, Rangers, Hibs & the Dundee clubs
item.description: Reaction after Motherwell beat Celtic, and wins for Rangers, Hibs, Dundee and Dundee Utd.

item.title: Football Daily
item.description: Arsenal increase their lead at the top of the Premier League table.

item.title: 'This year has been crazy' - Caballero

item.title: 'Definitely not' Semenyo's last game for Bournemouth - Iraola
item.description: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola reflects on his team's 2-2 draw against Chelsea and discusses speculation that forward Antoine Semenyo is set to leave the club in January.

item.title: Man Utd lacked imagination in 'strange' game - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says his side lacked imagination during their "strange" 1-1 draw with bottom side Wolves at Old Trafford.

item.title: Arsenal were outstanding in second half - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says his side were "outstanding" as they scored four second-half goals to beat Aston Villa 4-1.

item.description: Everton manager David Moyes praises the players that stepped up in the absence of others as his side claimed a 2-0 win over Nottingham Forest at the City Ground.

item.title: Bournemouth draw with Chelsea after chaotic first half
item.description: Bournemouth are winless against Chelsea in their last nine Premier League matches after drawing 2-2 at Stamford Bridge.

item.description: Burnley manager Scott Parker says he is disappointed that his side found themselves two goals only seven minutes in to their match against Newcastle United.

item.title: Burnley's Cullen out for 'prolonged period' with ACL injury
item.description: Burnley have confirmed captain Josh Cullen is set for a "prolonged period on the sidelines" after sustaining an anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee.

item.description: Arsenal score four second-half goals to beat Aston Villa 4-1 and end the year five points clear at the top of the Premier League table.

item.title: Wolves earn draw at Man Utd to end losing run
item.description: Ladislav Krejci equaliser earns Wolverhampton Wanderers their first point since October as they draw 1-1 at Manchester United.

item.title: Off the Ball take petty & ill-informed look at Scottish football
item.description: The most petty and ill-informed football show on radio.

item.title: Brighton come from behind twice to draw with West Ham

item.title: Garner & Barry score as Everton beat Forest
item.description: Midfielder James Garner scores and sets up Thierno Barry as Everton condemn his former side Nottingham Forest to a third straight defeat.

item.title: Kettlewell returns to County tasked with avoiding drop
